[b]Lost most of its charm.[/b]
You are able to finish the main story line in around 7 hours, even on the highest difficulty level. The story is rather well written but this once great game is made for people who can’t logically think anymore. It’s just way too easy thus way too “flat”.
I’d skip it or get it on some sale. The DLC is catering to the “Bioshock 2” crowd.
[spoiler]Also, screw that ending.[/spoiler]

Это рывок для серии без всякого сомнения. В обзоре на вторую часть я писал, что её можно и пропустить. Так вот, запустив, только запустив Infinite, я сразу понял что был прав. Графика стала ярче и приятнее, оружие не выглядит слепленным скотчем и им намного удобнее пользоваться, исчезла эта неприятная лично мне замкнутость пространства, сохранены атмосферность и антураж - на некоторые вещи так и тянет постоять полюбоваться несколько минут.
Сюже оставил смешанные чуства. С одной стороны всё класнно, очень классно. Но с другой - к концу всё так завернули, что у меня мозг потёк. Возможно когда-нибудь я перепройду всё это, попробую понять....
Стоит ли играть? Определённо. Тут вам и на красоты полюбоваться дадут, и настреляться вдоволь, и мозги поломать. Эта игра - важное слово в индустрии, возможно даже поважнее первой части.
This is one of the coolest games I have ever had the pleasure of playing.

Это единственный шутер где не  хочется много стрелять, да и перестрелки сами по себе не привлекают. Но сюжет и концовка, о боже это лучшее ,что я видел в видео играх, не конда не испытавал столько эмоций из-за игры, шедевер.
Solid FPS mechanics and an engrossing story with realistic characters make this a game that should be experienced.

[b]Note: Play the games in this order

Bioshock 1 > Bioshock 2 > Bioshock Infinite[/b]

The year is 1912 and you play as Booker DeWitt and you've been tasked with saving  a girl, Elizabeth , in the city of Columbia. 

The game is an Action FPS that is true to its genre. The game offers a fairly fast paced action that might sometimes feel a bit tedious. Bioshock Infinite contains a multitude of weapons that are era specific and are lovely to use.

You also have access to powers, known as vigors, which you can use to dispose of enemies or to just help you make your way through the game. The vigors can also be combined with each other making it an intriguing system to play around with.

In addition to Weapons and Vigors you have other tools, like the skyhook, which lets you jump around from hooks attached to the side off certain buildings.

The stealth system within the game is good. The detection is based around both sound and vision so walking on a carpet can suppress your footsteps while walking on puddles of water or broken glass will make them louder.

The games scenery and enviroments are absolutely outstanding. When I got the first glimpse of Columbia I was speechless. 

The voice acting in the game is great as well with excellent dialogue. I'm quite serious now, I can't describe how PERFECT some parts were with how the characters acted and what they said. This game has brought forward some amazing quotes. In addition to that, all of the characters are well made and very sympathetic. 

I like games that have a good story, and Bioshock Infinite has just that. The story  is incredibly rich when it comes to content and will leave you with memorable parts that will make you smile when you think back.

Bioshock Infinite is a game that you will not regret playing. It's fantastic.

edit - removed Chrono order to please people.

Mas não é só no visual que o jogo impressiona, já que a narrativa é surpreendente, Booker DeWitt precisa pagar uma dívida, e por isso é obrigado a ir para Columbia e resgatar uma garota, Elizabeth, filha do fundador da cidade e que por algum motivo  permanece trancada numa alta torre. Só que Columbia é uma cidade cheia de fanáticos religiosos e racistas, todos regidos pelo fundador, Comstock, um velho que também é conhecido como “O Profeta” daquela cidade. Para deixar as coisas um pouco mais confusas ainda, o game aborda física quântica e viagem no tempo, mas nunca embaralhando muito esses conceitos e apresentando-os aos poucos para o jogador.

The NPCs around the city are lively, interactive, and fun to watch.

Be warned there is some borderline non-PC topic material here, if ethnic commentary or male/female stereotypes bother you, just be aware.  NONE of that takes away from the game though, and it really lends itself to the authenticity of the setting.  So I appreciated that.

Anyway, the game!!

As you know if you read my reviews, all I really care about is that it is fun.  Is it?  Hell yes it is!

Yes it is more of the same Bioshock flavor in a new shinier serving.  But who cares.  If it ain't broke right?

The weapons are fun, the enemies are fun (Most of them ;P), the environments are fun.  The story got a little crazy at times and I had to slow down to keep up with it (I get lost in the shooting sometimes) but if you follow it close enough you'll be fine.

The Elizabeth "power" just makes everything that much more interesting.

Overall I don't think there were many times where I was rushing through a boring area or stumbling around lost.  So that is a plus.

On my scale of (Avoid--TBB (Try before Buy)--Play--Must Play) I give it a...

Sinceramente, no acabo de entender las notas tan desorbitadas que se le han dado a este juego.

Personalmente, considero Infinite, un "spin-off" de la saga y para nada una tercera parte.

A ver, vale. No voy a negar que sea un jodida maravilla gráficamente y que sea muy bonito de ver y blablabla... Pero coño, Infinite no es más que un BioShock capado y lineal hasta la saciedad.

Razones de porque es un BioShock capado:

· Para comenzar, se nos quita la opción de poder llevar todas las armas. Ahora únicamente podemos llevar 2, lo cual veo una verdadera mierda porque en las entregas anteriores, gracias a la gran variedad de armas que teníamos a nuestra disposición para llevar a la vez, podíamos escoger una arma u otra para acabar con según que enemigos. Ahora sólo podrás acabar con tus enemigos con lo que te encuentres por ahí. Y si las armas son una mierda, te jodes.

· Ya no podemos cargar con botiquines ni jeringuillas de EVE. Lo veo una auténtica mierda porque el estar en según que situaciones y no tener botiquines jode mucho o el tener toda la vida y encontrarte con un botiquín que no puedes guardarte para usar cuando tengas poca vida, también.

· Ya no hay Little Sisters ni Big Daddies ni ningún ser de esos de anteriores entregas. Se acabaron los finales alternativos y las misiones secundarias. Bueno, el juego tiene misiones secundarias (que se basan en volver 2 kilómetros atrás para buscar una llave o abrir algo) pero las puedes evitar perfectamente que no te pasará nada.

· Es jodidamente lineal. Sólo trata de echar hacia delante y cargarte a 3 o 4 soldaditos de vez en cuando, ya está. Algún que otro "Handyman" o "Patriota Motorizado" le da algo de vidilla, pero nada más.

· La mayoría de vigorizantes son de anteriores entregas o si no son "re-skins" (como por ejemplo los cuervos, que son las abejas)

El juego realmente trae pocas novedades a parte de que ahora los "plásmidos" pasen a llamarse "vigorizantes" (nombre feísimo) como lo son "el gancho aéreo", arma cuerpo a cuerpo curiosa y que a la vez nos servirá para montarnos en los carriles para ir de lado al lado de Columbia y Elizabeth.

Nunca he sido muy fan de que en los FPS tengas compañeros ya que me gusta que el protagonista puede enfrentarse a todos sus problemas él sólo, pero sinceramente Elizabeth no me ha parecido mala compañera. No estorba, es esencial para la historia, puede [spoiler]abrir desgarros para proporcionarnos torretas u otras cosas[/spoiler] y encima de vez en cuando nos pasa vida, munición o dinero. Una delicia de compañera (no como la asquerosa Alyx). 

Y bueno, poco más tengo que decir de esta decepción de juego. Que a ver que sí, que la historia muy bonita y esas cosas, pero jugablemente es aburrido y lineal hasta la saciedad y encima le han quitado cosas de las anteriores entregas.

Si quisiera disfrutar de una buena historia, me hubiera comprado un libro o hubiera visto una película, pero he pagado por un juego y quiero algo que jugablemente me divierta, sea entretenido y valga la pena.

[spoiler]El final es una copia del de la película "Looper"[/spoiler]

[spoiler]En este juego se muestra la América más nazi que he visto en mi vida. Racista a más no poder.[/spoiler]

Unlike previous Bioshock games, Inifnite, despite the name, leaves you with no choices of any importance. No matter how much you care about the world you play in, doing the right thing and hope and wish that the story has something of a happy end, it always has the same depressing and pointless ending, that ultimately makes a mockery of everything you experienced through out the entire game. 

The ending of the game is the worst and most pointless let-down I've ever experienced in a game, and almost enough to make me not recommend this game to others. 
However; the game is very entertaining up until that point. 
I have to give the creators credit for creating a game that made me feel this irritated about a bad ending, because that means that I truly did care about the story. 

Unlike previous Bioshock Games, the protagonist speaks in this game, and during the game you are only rarely presented with any meaningful choices. These choices do not matter at all, but you're still forced to choose. 

Often in the game, you may want to take certain radical actions, but the game will not allow you. This can be so infuriating that it leaves the player simply wanting to quick. 
The gameplay makes up for the frustrations, and offers a much more open-space to fight in than previous Bioshock games, with agility and strategy being important to succeed (at least on higher difficulties). 

I found it surprisingly difficult to gather up enough funds and resources in the game to upgrade all my abilities and also get the weapon upgrades I wanted. 

I recommend new players hold on to their money, and each time they enter a new "area", look up how many "infusions" are in the area - the game does not have a hard save/load function, and going back to find something you've missed is often extremely tedious. 

The achievements are somewhat fun to attempt to obtain, but I did find it unrewarding in the end.

Here's the thing: I don't normally like FPS games. There's only a handful which I enjoyed. Even the first two Bioshock games didn't do that much for me. Yes, the story was awesome, but I played the game mainly to for the story alone, although I really did enjoy using plasmids.

BioShock Infinite however had me playing continuously. I continuously wanted to see what was next. The world is beautiful and colorful. The vigors are awesome, although somewhat overpowered. (Crows) This game had me invested on the story 100% and I found the game mechanics, the shooting, the vigors, the guns, the movement incredibly satisfying. I played through this game three times. I did get all the tropies on PS3 and played it again when this was on Steam sale. It was even better to play on PC.

I would say BioShock Infinite breaks through the boundaries of the FPS and delivers a unique game and story experience beyond defined genres. It is incredibly violent but if you can stomach that I fully recommend it to anyone.

Etrange jeu. D'un côté une vaste arnaque qui à force de vouloir bouffer à tous les râteliers construit un gameplay tout en façade: pas un jeu d'exploration en monde libre mais un FPS couloir, un soupçon de tactique et de Roleplay illusoires qui favorisent en fait le bourrinisme et la recherche d'items compulsive, pas vraiment une réflexion sur le totalitarisme mais plutôt une narration à tiroirs fourre-tout. Mais cet espèce de gigantesque montage d'idées qui tend l'expérience de jeu vers le néant reste intéressante parce qu'elle redouble le contenu narratif et ses histoires de mondes parallèles et trouve un accomplissement dans l'incroyable direction artistique qui va encore plus loin dans le collage d'influences que les précédents Bioshock. On navigue de l'esthétique révolutionnaire communiste aux fantasmes de grandeur religieuse en passant par la Guerre de sécession, l'art antique, tout ça passé au mixeur Jules Verne, et cela de manière assez organique et cohérente.
Du coup on comprend très vite que l'intérêt du jeu réside presque uniquement dans la contemplation. Les phases de jeu ne servant qu'à générer des images, la First Person devient un prétexte à la scrutation et visuellement il faut avouer que le jeu en a sous le pied (même si l'émerveillement du début du jeu tend à s'estomper au fur et à mesure). Donc même si le jeu est une grosse déception en terme de gameplay (je ne me souviens plus des précédents opus mais j'avais pas souvenir d'un tel manque), ça reste une expérience qui vaut le détour. Il faut juste le prendre comme une longue balade dans un immense générateur d'imagerie détraqué.

Колумбия. Красочный мир, парящий далеко в небесах, попасть в который может далеко не каждый. Он имеет много тайн и пошел по пути своего развития, своей веры, своих технологий, своего общества. [h1] [b] Сюжет [/b] [/h1]

Игра оставляет больше вопросов, нежели ответов, и ко многим вещам приходишь не сразу, сначала строя множество своих теорий, а потом самостоятельно же их и разрушая. Тем не менее, если быть внимательным, то о многом можно догадаться ближе к концу игры.

[h1] [b] Геймплей [/b] [/h1]

Обычный шутер с элементами магии. Просто, без заморочек пускаешь в расход сотни людей, собирая соли. книги и монетки, которые можно потратить на улучшения оружия. Впрочем, ничего нового.

[h1] [b] Звук [/b] [/h1]

Музыка 20-го века Америки немного доставляет. Озвучка героев сделана прекрасно, все оружие издает характерный для него звук, скрежет металла, скрип деревянного пола, плеск воды - все это, несомненно, добавляет игре свой шарм неповторимости, и выделяет среди многих продуктов в Steam.

[h1] [b] Графика [/b] [/h1]

Игра просто красивая. Все такое насыщенное, цветное, живое. Тени, вода, взрывы, кровь - просто загляденье. А в скриптованных сценах со взрывами, разрушениями, откровенными диалогами между персонажами иногда забываешь, что играешь в шутер.

The gameplay is the usual mix of conventional weapons and creative use of your Plas- excuse me, your Vigors and the environment. The skylines make it a lot easier to get around the battle stages, and the tears add even more potential for crazy chaos, although they sometimes feel like they're there just so Elizabeth has something to do. I'm not a big fan of the carry limit on guns though; like a lot of modern shooters, Bioshock Infinite allows you to only carry 2 guns with you at any time. In a game series that's all about creative combat, this feels like an odd choice (although the number of different guns in the game is huge), and fortunately the devs chose to go back to letting you carry all weapons at once for Burial At Sea.

The game is less about scavenging than the first one. You still get some freedom about the way you explore an area (and going straight for the objective will mean you miss out on a lot), but it lacks the sense of desolation that you get in Bioshock 1 and 2, simply because in those two games, you walk around in Rapture after the civil war, while Infinite takes place before/during the civil war in Columbia. It makes sense but I still miss it.

The graphics are stunning. Columbia looks absolutely gorgeous, the first time you see the city is very reminiscent of the first time you see Rapture in the original Bioshock (and also an obvious call-back to that famous scene, only the bathysphere is a rocket this time). Rapture also looks incredible in the Burial At Sea DLC.

Unfortunately, the game holds itself up considerably less well in terms of storyline and characters. Frankly, Father Comstock just isn't nearly as interesting a villain as Andrew Ryan, and the struggle between him and the Vox almost boring compared to the battle between Ryan and Atlas. In that regard, Fink feels like he would have made for a much better big bad. This becomes even more painfully obvious in Burial At Sea, when old characters make their returns.
The Luteces, on the other hand, are absolutely brilliantly voiced by Courtnee Draper and Troy Baker as two bickering siblings, and the moments in the game where you encounter them are among my favourite.

I'm not going to say much about the ending to the main story. Yes, it sucks. As for the ending to Burial At Sea, well... That made a lot more sense, actually.

Altogether Bioshock Infinite is not a perfect game, but I had a LOT of fun playing it, and I fully recommend it and the Burial At Sea DLC.

Главное, что выделяет BioShock Infinite на фоне большинства громких новинок последнего времени, — это удивительная цельность и единство всех элементов игры. Здесь нет ничего лишнего — ни «приклеенной» RPG-составляющей, ни надуманных сюжетных поворотов. Геймплей, сценарий, графика, музыка в синхронном звучании создают поистине потрясающую стимпанковскую атмосферу. Когда ты проходишь по солнечным улицам парящей над небесным сводом Колумбии, слышишь приятную музыку, раздающуюся из каждого радиоустройства, подбираешь всякую дребедень, а твои действия сопровождаются характерным «биошоковским» треском и хрустом, то понимаешь, что мир Infinite совершенно уникален, и одно лишь нахождение в нем становится настоящим праздником.

Дизайнеры уровней проделали, не побоюсь этого слова, грандиозную работу. Внешний облик Колумбии заставит трепетать сердца даже самых притязательных любителей графики. Локации разнообразны, декорации на протяжении всего прохождения постоянно меняются, каждый квадратный метр города полон каких-то мелких деталей. Хочется ходить по этому миру, заглядывая в каждый закоулок, слушая все диалоги случайных прохожих, просматривая наборы забавных картинок в каждом кинетоскопе.

Немаловажную роль в погружении в мир играют аудиозаписи, повсюду разбросанные жителями города и главными действующими лицами.

BioShock Infinite really utilizes its art style and general look very well, its usual mindscrewing plot line is in full effect here too. The end result is a damn good game that's certainly worth your time if you haven't played it yet.

DLC's a bit more complicated. Clash in the Clouds is a basic arena fighting expansion but offers enough content within that to actually be an enjoyable purchase, though expensive (thus picking up the Season Pass or this DLC on sale is worth it). On the other hand we have Burial At Sea Episode 1 and 2 that brings the story together with the original BioShocks, which I was looking forward to more than CiC. Ironically enough, it's not as good. It IS good because it's more Rapture and it's an interesting look at Rapture, even if we're back seeing mad splicers and wrecked building interiors all over again. It also is more BioShock story and general atmosphere.

To best describe it though is to mention a short "event" that occurs near the beginning of Episode 2. One of Cohen's little pieces to be precise. It's a shock video, you watch it, weird things happen, it plays with your expectations, but you have this nagging feeling you know what's going to happen. Then it happens, a spooky thing jumps out behind you AHHHHHH! Oh wait, you saw it coming, it wasn't quite as shocking as was intended. That's Burial at Sea. It does some pretty interesting things with expectations but you still see it coming from far enough away to rob BaS of its story shock value, which BioShock does a good job at offering normally. So is it really necessary? Well, I'm not sure. It feels a whole lot like BioShock Lite more than a nice expansion, even if it looks pretty damn sharp. And don't get me started on the fact that stealth is a huge mechanic in Episode 2. It's interesting but not a lot of fun to mess with.

But yeah, BioShock Infinite is still a good game, it's DLC is a bit more mixed.
